meanings.definition: A mistake or error, especially one made during filming or broadcasting.
meanings.sent1: During the movie, there were many bloopers that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: The TV show's blooper reel showed all the mistakes the actors made.
meanings.sent3: The blooper of the actor forgetting their lines added humor to the scene.
meanings.sent4: Her blooper on live TV was like a bright red balloon popping in a quiet room.
meanings.sent5: The director kept a collection of bloopers to learn from and improve the next film.

meanings.definition: To make a mistake or error, especially in a public or embarrassing way.
meanings.sent1: She bloopers during her speech and felt embarrassed.
meanings.sent2: He bloopers by tripping on stage during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The comedian intentionally bloopers to make the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: His bloopers at work were like colorful confetti falling from the sky.
meanings.sent5: The singer bloopers on live TV, creating a memorable moment for viewers.
